title: Army in China under Communist Party, not govt.

content.prompt: Which of the following statements accurately describes control of the People's Liberation Army (PLA) in China?

choices.label: A clear chain of command exists, extending from the President directly to the Ministry of Defense.
A clear chain of command exists, from the National People's Congress to the Ministry of Defense.
Following the events at Tiananmen Square, a constitutional commission was formed to make recommendations to ensure greater civilian control over the armed forces.
Although the party doctrine calls for the party's surveillance of the army, the generals have usually exercised autonomous control over their own troops.
Although the constitution formally estab­lishes a chain of command through the National People's Congress, the Commu­nist Party has retained significant influence over the armed forces.
